result.execSummary:
The defendant Lori Ann Wittchow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:23 P.M., Defendant Lori Ann Wittchow in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Court finds defendant guilty, Judgment to be entered, Court sentences defendant to: probation 2 years, $518.00 costs, AODA and comply, defendant to submit DNA Sample, 45 days sentence credit, 3:45 P.M.

defendant appeared

Defendant Lori Ann Wittchow by video,  in custody with attorney Alexander J. Kostal.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Address updated. Court advised this was to be held in front of Br. 1 Judge Hepler per notes from last hearing. Bond argument by State and Atty Kostal. Court set $10,000.00 cash bond. Standard felony conditions. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant was advised to reapply to the SPD office by Court. Warrant quashed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2018 at 02:10 pm.  Return date scheduled for October 23, 2018 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Lori Ann Wittchow in court with attorney Randall M Holtz. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
